qas.question: Who are some of the famous Irish Mandolinists?
Who are popular fiddle player and tenor banjo player?

answers.text: John Sheahan and the late Barney McKenna

qas.question: What was John Sheahan and Barney Mckenna's band called?
Who made the instruments used by the Dubliners?

answers.text: UK luthier Roger Bucknall of Fylde Guitars

qas.question: What Irish guitarist played the mandolin on stage?
Who are some of the famous Italian Mandolinists?

plausible_answers.text: John Sheahan and the late Barney McKenna

qas.question: Who are unpopular fiddle player and tenor banjo player?
What was John Sheahan and Barney Mckenna's job called?

plausible_answers.text: UK luthier Roger Bucknall of Fylde Guitars

qas.question: Who made the instruments used by the Italian group?
What Irish guitarist played the mandolin off stage?

context: Noteworthy Irish mandolinists include <a0_0><b5_0>Andy Irvine<b5_0/><a0_0/> (who, like Johnny Moynihan, almost always tunes the top E down to D, to achieve an open tuning of GDAD), Paul Brady, Mick Moloney, Paul Kelly and Claudine Langille. <a1_0><b6_0>John Sheahan and the late Barney McKenna<b6_0/><a1_0/>, respectively fiddle player and tenor banjo player with <a2_0><b7_0>The Dubliners<b7_0/>,<a2_0/> are also accomplished Irish mandolin players. The instruments used are either flat-backed, oval hole examples as described above (made by <a3_0><b8_0>UK luthier Roger Bucknall of Fylde Guitars<b8_0/><a3_0/>), or carved-top, oval hole instruments with arched back (made by Stefan Sobell in Northumberland). The Irish guitarist <a4_0><b9_0>Rory Gallagher<b9_0/><a4_0/> often played the mandolin on stage, and he most famously used it in the song "Going To My Hometown."
